sources.title: The House of Fear
sources.description: Sherlock Holmes investigates a series of deaths at a castle with each foretold by the delivery of orange pips to the victims.

sources.title: The House of Fear (1945)
sources.description: The Good Comrades are a collection of varied gentlemen who crave one thing - solitude. They reside at Drearcliff House, ancestral home of their eldest member. All seems serene and convivial until one by one the members begin to perish in the most grisly of manners. Foul play is suspected by the Good Comrades' insurance agent, who turns to Sherlock Holmes and Dr. John Watson for guidance. Watch on RetroFlix:  https://retroflix.org/the-house-of-fear-1945/

sources.title: THE HOUSE OF FEAR video quality upgrade
sources.description: This print is much less than perfect. However the heavy blue cast has been removed and the excessive contrast reduced. Also now it is in the standard MPEG4 (MP4) format with a smaller down footprint.   “Creaky but fun” “More than fascinating” “Good early talkie” (IMDB reviews quotes).   William Powell as Philo Vance is confronted with a murder mystery and an old mansion filled suspects at each others throats. Good cast and superior production values for a 68-minute whodunit. Followed by “The Bishop Murder Case.” IMDB rating 6.8. Directed by Frank Tuttle. Released in 1929. Complete print. AKA “The Greene Murder Case”

metadata.Plot: Seven rich men retire to a Scottish castle and promptly begin to die in violent fashion. Each death is preceded by the delivery of orange pips to the next target. As all the likely victims are heaviliy insured, Sherlock Holmes is asked by the insurance companies to investigate.
metadata.Actors: Basil Rathbone, Nigel Bruce, Aubrey Mather
